===JQuery UI Button as Wicket behavior example===

*[http://jqueryui.com/demos/button/ Original javascript version can be found here]*

*Prerequisites:* Your wicket application is configured to use JQWicket as described in the [http://code.google.com/p/jqwicket "Quick Start"] guide. Additionaly to the jquery core library you have to add "jquery ui" to the JQWicket's config.

*Description:* This example demonstrates how to integrate JQuery UI Button with the wicket components using JQWicket.

*Java-Code:*
{{{
public class ButtonPage extends WebPage {
	public ButtonPage() {
 
		// create button with default button behavior
		add(new Button("b1").add(new ButtonBehaivor()));

		// create wicket link as jqueryui button with some additional options
		Link<Void> b2 = new Link<Void>("b2") {
			@Override
			public void onClick() {
				// do something here
			}
		};
		b2.add(new ButtonBehaivor(new ButtonOptions().label("my label").disabled(true)));
		add(b2);
	}
}
}}}

*Html-Template:*
{{{
<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Transitional//EN"
	"http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">
<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"
	xmlns:wicket="http://wicket.apache.org/" xml:lang="en" lang="en">
<head>
<title>Button example</title>
</head>
<body>
<button wicket:id="b1">A button element</button>
<a wicket:id="b2" href="#">An anchor</a>
</body>
</html>
}}}
